title: Intend Launches More Affordable Essential Inverted Fork
content:
Intend makes super high-end forks, brakes, and rear shocks. Intend’s inverted fork was seen on the Prova full suspension from our MADE coverage last year. The brand just announced its more affordable 150-170 mm Essential (1449€) inverted fork, which comes in at a 300 € cheaper pricepoint than its top of the line equivalent…

By reducing variety and assembly/production expenses by making a single batch of 85 pcs in one production, Intend is able to offer the Essential fork at a more attractive price point.

The Intend Essential suspension fork is the entry-level fork for anyone who wants to save some bucks for the rest of their next dream build. That doesn’t mean you’re missing out on performance, though, because Intend made sure to integrate as much technology as possible.

The Essential fork comes with a cerakoted BCT crown, and its trusted enduro proven steerer tube and upper legs. The fork has a travel range of 150 – 170 mm. It utilizes a simple yet flawless air spring and an open bath damping cartridge which give you that supple and high quality feeling you might or might not (yet) be used to from Intend products and they’re also very user-friendly to service.

Will you save money over a top-line Intend fork? Yes.

Will you feel a decrease in performance? Maybe yes, but maybe not

What are the differences to the Top-Line Originals and Blackline forks?

The Air spring does not have the Travelizer adjustment. That means you need to disassemble the fork to change the travel.

It also does not work with the token-less technology by changing the bottom caps for progression. It works with a volume spacer in the bottom cap to adjust this. This volume spacer has three positions:

  • Without, less progression
  • Mid position, mid progression (installed in the fork already)
  • Max position, max progression

This new Intend Essential shares the same damping parts as the Originals and Blackline forks, but it’s a semi-open bath system instead of the closed bladder version.

Is it possible to swap the Essential forks to the Intend Top-line internals?

Yes, but this means the complete bottom section needs to be changed, which is just as expensive as buying a Top-line fork in the first place. This gives you the opportunity to experience an Intend fork for a lower price but being able to upgrade to the latest internal technology at a later point in time.

This fork is for you IF you do not need the latest internal tech and features, but you want to have the benefits and experience of an Intend fork.

Disclaimer: The first batch of forks will not be compatible with the Linearizer – the Intend retrofit dual positive air chamber.

Specs:

  • Fork Offset / Rake 44mm
  • Travel 150 – 170 mm
  • Steerer Tube Length 240mm
  • Stanchions Diameter 35mm
  • Axle to Crown 170mm (581.5) /160mm (571.5) …you get the idea!
  • Steerer Tube Tapered 1 1/8″ – 1,5″ (inner diameter: 23mm)
  • Dropout 15mm x 110mm boost or 20mm x 110mm boost
  • Brake mount 180mm, 203mm or 220mm brake mount included
  • Designed, engineered & tested in Freiburg / Germany
  • Assembled 100% in-house and by hand – One at a time

See more at Intend.
